definitions.definition: before now or before a particular time in the past
definitions.labels: North American EnglishNorth American EnglishBritish EnglishBritish EnglishNorth American English(British English)(North American English)

examples.text: We got there early but Mike had already left.
By 2025, filming of the sequel was already under way.
Much of what he said I knew already.

definitions.definition: used to express surprise that something has happened so soon or so early

examples.text: You're not leaving already, are you?

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that a situation or problem exists

examples.text: The new company already has an excellent reputation.
There are far too many people already. We can't take any more.

definitions.definition: used after a word or phrase to show that you are annoyed

examples.text: Just stop already, no one feels sorry for you.

definitions.definition: used to say that something is annoying or boring and that you want it to stop

wordOrigin: Middle English: from the adverb all + ready.
